title: Mortehoe Circular Walking Route

images.title: Richard Croft / Mortehoe, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View of central Mortehoe from St.Mary's churchyard

images.title: Philip Halling / Bull Point Lighthouse, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Bull Point Lighthouse stands on the north Devon coast to the west of Ilfracombe, it was established in 1879, electrified in 1960 and automated in 1975. Its signal is 3 white flashes every 10 seconds.

images.title: Trish Steel [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The coastal cemetery, Mortehoe. Looking out across the cemetery of St Mary's Church. The air-sea rescue helicopter in the distance and Lundy on the horizon.

images.title: Stephen McKay / Coastal Paths, near Mortehoe, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Coastal Paths, near Mortehoe. At this point the path from Mortehoe village joins the coastal path between Morte Point and Bull Point. This stretch of coast is National Trust land.

images.title: Richard Croft / Rockham Bay, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rockham Bay. Spectacular view across Rockham Bay with Bull Point Lighthouse in the distance

images.title: Stephen McKay / Chichester Arms, Mortehoe, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Chichester Arms, Mortehoe. 16th century pub standing in a prominent position just south of the church. There are still some gas lights in use in the bar.

description: This circular walk from Mortehoe visits Morte Point, Rockham Bay and Bull Point on the North Devon Coast. It's a lovely section of Exmoor coast with dramatic cliffs, beautiful countryside and pretty beaches. The area is managed by the National Trust so there are good footpaths and facilities in the area. The walk starts from the village of Mortehoe where there is a village car park. You follow a footpath through the countryside to Morte Point where there are some fascinating rock formations and great views towards Lundy Island. You then head east along the coast path to Bull Point, passing the lovely Rockham Bay and beach on the way. You should see lots of pretty wildlflowers in the summer along this stretch. Just after Bull Point you pick up an inland footpath which takes you back to the village. Here you can enjoy refreshments at the Smuggler's Rest pub. You could also visit the Mortehoe Musuem and learn about the interesting history of smuggling and shipwrecks in the area. It's easy to extend your walking in this lovely area by heading along the coast path to nearby Ilfracombe via Lee Bay. You could also visit the Woolacombe with its beautiful beaches and beyond that Baggy Point .
